info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued March 03 at 3:51AM CST until March 03 at 7:00PM CST by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 7 PM CST THIS EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE WESTERN OKLAHOMA PANHANDLE... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE WESTERN OKLAHOMA PANHANDLE... * Affected Area...In the Oklahoma Panhandle...Cimarron County. * 20 Foot Winds...Today, south southwest 15 to 20 mph with gusts to 25 mph. Friday, southwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 40 mph. * Relative Humidity...Today, as low as 4 percent. Friday, as low as 14 percent. * Red Flag Threat Index...Today, 4. Friday, 3 to 4. * Timing...Today, 1 PM to 7 PM CST. Friday, 12 PM to 7 PM CST.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now...or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures will create favorable weather for rapid fire growth and spread. Avoid activities that promote open flames and sparks. A Fire Weather Watch means that the potential for critical fire weather conditions exists. Listen for later forecasts and possible red flag warnings.
